org.gridlab.gat.io
Class DefaultFileStreamAdaptor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--FileStreamCpi
        |
        +--org.gridlab.gat.io.DefaultFileStreamAdaptor
public class DefaultFileStreamAdaptor
extends FileStreamCpi

A DefaultFileStreamAdaptor represents a connection to open file, the file may be either remote or local.

A DefaultFileStreamAdaptor represents a seekable connection to a file and has semantics similar to a standard Unix filedescriptor. It provides methods to query the current position in the file and to seek to new positions.

To Write data to a DefaultFileStreamAdaptor it is necessary to construct a Buffer and pack it with data. Similarly, to read data a buffer must be created to store the read data. Writes and reads may either be blocking, or asynchronous. Asynchronous writes or reads must be completed by appropriate call.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

DefaultFileStreamAdaptor

public DefaultFileStreamAdaptor(GATContext gatContext,
                                Location location,
                                int mode)
                         throws java.io.IOException
This creates a DefaultFileStreamAdaptor attached to the physical file at the specified Location. The file may be opened in several modes:
  • FileStream.READ --- Open file for reading. The stream is positioned at the beginning of the file.
  • FileStream.WRITE --- Truncate file to zero length or create file for writing. The stream is positioned at the beginning of the file.
  • FileStream.READWRITE --- Open for reading and writing. The stream is positioned at the beginning of the file.
  • FileStream.APPEND --- Open for appending (writing at end of file). The file is created if it does not exist. The stream is positioned at the end of the file.

Parameters:
gatContext - The GATContext used to broker resources
location - The Location of the file to open.
mode - The mode to open it --- READ, WRITE, READWRITE, or APPEND, member variables of this class
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown upon an I/O error of some sort

position

public long position()
              throws java.io.IOException
This returns the current position in the file.

Returns:
The current position in the file, a long
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown upon an I/O error of some sort

seek

public void seek(long offset,
                 int whence)
          throws java.io.IOException
This changes the current position in the file. The position can either be calculated from the current position in the file or from the beginning or end.

Parameters:
offset - A long, from whence
whence - One of the member variables used for this purpose, BEGINNING, CURRENT or END of file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown upon an I/O error of some sort

flush

public void flush()
Make sure that any underlying file-writing mechanisms have flushed data to disk.

read

public void read(Buffer buffer)
          throws java.io.IOException
Reads from this Streamable into the given buffer.

This is a blocking call and only returns if the buffer is full or there is no more data to read.

Parameters:
buffer - The Buffer into which data are to be transferred
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown upon an I/O error of some sort

write

public void write(Buffer buffer)
           throws java.io.IOException
Writes data from the given Buffer to the Streamable. The buffer is not modified.

This is a blocking call and only returns when all the data in the buffer has been sent.

Parameters:
buffer - The Buffer from which data are to be transferred
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown upon an I/O error of some sort

iRead

public void iRead(Buffer buffer)
Reads from this Streamable into the given buffer, but returning immediately. The buffer should not be used until a ReadWait has been called on this Streamable.

Only one iRead may be active at once on a given Streamable.

This is a non-blocking call.

Parameters:
buffer - The Buffer into which data are to be transferred

readFinish

public boolean readFinish()
                   throws java.io.IOException
This finishes the current iRead call on this Streamable. All data received between posting the iRead and this call will be available in the associated buffer on return.

Returns:
A boolean indicating if data was received
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown upon an I/O error of some sort

readTest

public boolean readTest()
This tests if data has been received in the current iRead.

Returns:
A boolean indicating if data was received

iWrite

public void iWrite(Buffer buffer)
Writes data from the given Buffer to the Streamable, but returning immediately. The buffer should not be used until a WriteWait has been called on this Streamable. The buffer is not modified, but the position of the next item in the buffer which would be sent is returned, and this can be used to remove old data from the buffer.

This is a non-blocking call.

Parameters:
buffer - The Buffer from which data are to be transferred

writeFinish

public long writeFinish()
                 throws java.io.IOException
This finishes the current iWrite call on this Streamable. Not all data in the buffer may have been sent.

Returns:
The position in the buffer right after the last data sent, a long
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown upon an I/O error of some sort

writeTest

public long writeTest()
Tests if data has been sent from the current iWrite call on this Streamable.

Returns:
The position in the buffer right after the last data sent, a long

addMetricListener

public void addMetricListener(MetricListener metricListener,
                              Metric metric)
This method adds the passed instance of a MetricListener to the java.util.List of MetricListeners which are notified of MetricEvents by an instance of this class. The passed MetricListener is only notified of MetricEvents which correspond to Metric instance passed to this method.

Parameters:
metricListener - The MetricListener to notify of MetricEvents
metric - The Metric corresponding to the MetricEvents for which the passed MetricListener will be notified

                                 Metric metric)

Parameters:
metricListener - The MetricListener to notify of MetricEvents
metric - The Metric corresponding to the MetricEvents for which the passed MetricListener will be notified

getMetrics

public java.util.List getMetrics()
This method returns a java.util.List of Metric instances. Each Metric instance in this java.util.List is a Metric which can be monitored on this instance.

Returns:
An java.util.List of Metric instances. Each Metric instance in this java.util.List is a Metric which can be monitored on this instance.
